Document the Incident: Take screenshots of your route, the fare, and any messages exchanged with the driver or support. My opinion FWIW. Pick Me is cheaper, air-conditioned, can use tollways (if you are going on a longer trip but you will pay the tolls - it’s worth it.). However, not as ubiquitous as Uber etc in other countries, so try to book a long while in advance of your desired departure. If you can’t get a match, then you can always fall back to Tuk Tuk - however prices are more expensive and very elastic for tourists - ensure your price BEFORE you get in.

PS on the “fights” for space. Depends where you are. In some areas there are “overlords” (for want of a better word) who control areas for parking - say, outside a major bus or train station etc (usually the most shady sections.) Tuk Tuks have to pay to wait in these spots for rides - so yes, THAT area may be unavailable to Pick Me or other drivers and accounts for a bit higher pricing for Tuk Tuk (but not all - quite a bit of pricing is a rip off.) However - seriously - just walk 50-100 metres further down to a less crowded spot. Worst place we found is Ella - traffic is very busy and tight with many police controlling who can go where. At that time, we had a private driver and car. He often had to wait a long way up the road, but was allowed by police to stop momentarily outside a large restaurant to pick us up. He just couldn’t park there and wait for us. Just ignore Tuk Tuk advice - if you want to ride that way, or just can’t get a Pick Me, then do get a Tuk Tuk. But guess what?
